quote: Students of the heavens are separable into astronomers and astrologers as readily as are the minor domestic ruminants into sheep and goats, but the separation of philosophers into sages and cranks seems to be more sensitive to frames of reference.
author: Willard Van Orman Quine

quote: To the untutored sage, the concentration of population was the prolific mother of all evils, moral no less than physical. He argued that food is good, while surfeit kills; that love is good, but lust destroys; and not less dreaded than the pestilence following upon crowded and unsanitary dwellings was the loss of spiritual power inseparable from too close contact with one's fellow-men.
author: Charles Alexander Eastman,  The Soul of the Indian

quote: A clever person solves a problem; a wise person uses Cosmic Ordering!
author: Stephen Richards,  Cosmic Ordering: You can be successful

quote: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
author: Baltasar Gracián,  The Art of Worldly Wisdom

quote: A wise person is silent and rarely wants to show his wisdom. A fool is always vocal and uses every opportunity to show his foolishness.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Everybody wants to have intimate conversations, but the smart fellows don't give out only the fools. The smart fellows talk intimately about the fools, and examine them all over and give them advice.
author: Saul Bellow,  Seize the Day

quote: The fool who knows his folly Becomes wise by that fact.But the fool who thinks he's wise - He's called 'a fool' indeed!
author: Anonymous,  The Dhammapada

quote: Amida's unimpeded light is the sun of wisdom that destroys the mind of darkness.(Preface in Teaching, Practice, Faith, Enlightenment)
author: Kentetsu Takamori,  You Were Born for a Reason: The Real Purpose of Life

quote: A wise person does at once, what a fool does at last. Both do the same thing; only at different times.
author: John Emerich Edward Dalberg-Acton

quote: We don’t know anything about silent sages, buried knowledge, the eye of the mute poet, serene seers, yet how many talkative destroyers, prophets and ideologues, teachers and beautifiers there are on the other side.
author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Shape

quote: The only person who is spiritually smart is the one who has learned how to learn, unlearn, and change directions instantly, and start all over again, if your soul calls for it.
author: Michelle Casto

quote: I'm the warlock who's here to cure you. Didn't they tell you I was coming?""I know who you are, but..."Maia looked dazed. "You look so...so...shiny.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides,  The Bacchae

quote: A wise master teaches.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: A clever person solves a problem. A wise person avoids it.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Philosophers have often held disputeAs to the seat of thought in man and bruteFor that the power of thought attends the latterMy friend, thy beau, hath made a settled matter,And spite of dogmas current in all ages,One settled fact is better than ten sages. (O,Tempora! O,Mores!)
author: Edgar Allan Poe,  The Complete Stories and Poems

quote: What's a philosopher?' said Brutha.Someone who's bright enough to find a job with no heavy lifting,' said a voice in his head.
author: Terry Pratchett,  Small Gods

quote: Wisdom is worth more than gold.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare,  As You Like It

quote: A person is wise if he listens to millions of advice and doesn't implement any of it.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson

quote: Wisest is she who knows she does not know.
author: Jostein Gaarder,  Sophie's World

quote: I'm not the smartest fellow in the world, but I can sure pick smart colleagues.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: A wise man always has something to say, whereas a fool always needs to say something.
author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S

quote: Smartass Disciple: Master, what is the secret recipe of your happiness?Master of Stupidity: If I tell you, there is nobody left to be made fun of.
author: Toba Beta

quote: In the long run, the sharpest weapon of all is a kind and gentle spirit.
author: Anne Frank,  The Diary of Anne Frank

quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Socrates

quote: Wise men talk because they have something to say; Fools, because they have to say something.
author: Plato

quote: Only divine love bestows the keys of knowledge.
author: Arthur Rimbaud

quote: An intelligent person looks for problems to solve. The wise person looks for solutions.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: In order to share one's true brilliance one initially has to risk looking like a fool: genius is like a wheel that spins so fast, it at first glance appears to be sitting still.
author: Criss Jami,  Venus in Arms

quote: Sometimes one likes foolish people for their folly, better than wise people for their wisdom.
author: Elizabeth Gaskell,  Wives and Daughters

quote: Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.
author: Bob Marley

quote: Enlightenment is light.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Who is wise? He that learns from everyone. Who is powerful? He that governs his passions. Who is rich? He that is content. Who is that? Nobody.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Stand in the divine rain, and seeds of wisdom will grow in your soul.
author: Peter Kreeft

quote: Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.
author: Euripides,  The Bacchae

quote: A wise man first thinks and then speaks and a fool speaks first and then thinks.
author: Hazrat Ali ibn Abu-Talib

quote: He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring

quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

quote: That man is best who sees the truth himself. Good too is he who listens to wise counsel. But who is neither wise himself nor willing to ponder wisdom is not worth a straw.
author: Hesiod

quote: Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before.
author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Cat's Cradle

quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; Skill is knowing how to do it, and Virtue is doing it.
author: David Starr Jordan

quote: I am striving to give back the Divine in myself to the Divine in the All.
author: Plotinus

quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Wisdom is one of the few things that looks bigger the further away it is.
author: Terry Pratchett,  Witches Abroad

quote: The person who knows one thing and does it better than anyone else, even if it only be the art of raising lentils, receives the crown he merits. If he raises all his energy to that end, he is a benefactor of mankind and its rewarded as such.
author: Og Mandino

quote: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The path of genius is free, and its own
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Those who try to juggle wisdom, power and greed, drop one of the balls, every time.”—Zarost
author: Greg Hamerton,  The Riddler's Gift

quote: I felt like poisoning a monk.
author: Umberto Eco,  Postscript to the Name of the Rose
